description.narrative:
This project forms part of the Strategic Partnership 2022-2025 between MFA and the Danish civil society organisations.
It aims to implement the priorities from the Danish development strategy, “The World We Share,” through dynamic and mutually reinforcing partnerships with independent Danish organisations on shared priorities, namely democratic values and human rights, fragile contexts and displacement, and climate and green solutions.
Strategic Partnerships receive one grant with funding for both development assistance and for humanitarian emergencies (listed here as separate engagements).
Due to the strategic focus of the partnerships, results are reported at an aggregated level across countries and themes to show contributions to changes through case studies and crosscutting indicators.

Three strategic priorities permeate across all strategic partnerships in the period. Democratic values and human rights, fragile context and displacement, and climate and green solutions are present through different approaches and varying emphasis in line with the technical capacity and the partner’s core competencies.
